channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Super Bowl streaming stopped being free
item.description: Watching the Super Bowl without cable keeps getting more expensive. NBC will not offer a free stream of Super Bowl LX in 2026, an NBCUniversal spokesp...

item.title: Can’t Read Books Anymore? Neuroscience Has a 5-Step Plan to Get Your Focus Back
item.description: Many of us are struggle to focus enough to read a whole books. Neuroscience says that’s terrible news for our brains but offers a fix.

item.title: Gen Z’s latest status symbol is running a marathon—and it’s terrible news for Gucci, Louis Vuitton, and Hermès
item.description: “I feel like saying that you ran—or that you run, or that you're going to run—the New York City Marathon is huge clout in New York,” one influencer sa...

item.title: Steve Jobs Said 5 Timeless Principles Create Lifelong Success (and Happiness)
item.description: Five of my favorite Steve Jobs perspectives.

item.title: How Emotionally Intelligent People Use ‘the 8:4 Rule’ to Increase Productivity, Avoid Burnout, and Find More Joy
item.description: Looking for a way to re-ignite your fire? Try splitting your time into “seasons.”

item.title: U.S. Olympic medalist barely earns enough to cover rent but makes 5 times more on social media

item.title: Starbucks’s CEO announces a huge change to win back customers
item.description: When Howard Schultz joined—and later acquired—Starbucks in the 1980s, he was deeply inspired by the communal culture of Italian coffee bars. From the ...

item.title: What if everything you think you know about passwords is wrong? Here’s what really makes a strong password in 2026
item.description: February 1 was National Change Your Password Day, a well-intentioned reminder that, ironically, highlights everything wrong with how we think about se...

item.title: You’re definitely going to watch Rocket’s Super Bowl ad. The company made sure of it
item.description: Prices for a 30-second spot during the Super Bowl on NBC this year averaged $8 million. For the privilege of paying that, advertisers are required to ...

item.title: State Officials Warn That ICE Is Upending Businesses Across the U.S.
item.description: Fiscal leaders told the White House that local economies are suffering as a result of recent immigration activity.

item.title: Disney’s Bob Iger achieves an essential feat for outgoing CEOs: giving his successor a clean slate
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Why being adaptable is an important skill in today’s world (and how to cultivate it)

item.title: When the music stops: the unravelling of AI companies’ flawed valuations
item.description: Right now, we’re already slipping into the Trough of Disillusionment and when the AI bubble bursts, the flawed valuations will be exposed.

item.title: Why SaaS Companies Keep Dying Off in the AI Age
item.description: The evidence keeps piling up, yet companies are riding and dying with the Same Old SaaS.

item.title: OpenAI’s new model leaps ahead in coding capabilities—but raises unprecedented cybersecurity risks
item.description: Why OpenAI’s latest coding breakthrough is forcing the company to rethink how—and how fast—it can deploy its most powerful models.
